chapter.title: High Availability abd Fault Tolerance
chapter.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE supports clustering, be it simple high availability or complete fault tolerance support, achieved through replication of the container state.
&THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE also exposes a clustering API for JAIN SLEE Resource Adaptors, the components which live outside the container.

variablelist.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE clustering is defined by the server profile used to run the container:

listitem.para: this configuration provides no state replication, thus useful for pure high availability cluster setups

this configuration provides state replication, thus useful for fault tolerance cluster setups. All activity context and sbb entity data is replicated across the cluster, and there is timers fail over, i.e, all timers running in a node that leaves the cluster are recreated and run in another node. Events are not failed over, due to performance constraints, which means that an event fired and not yet routed will be lost if its cluster node fails

important.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE reuses &JEE.PLATFORM; clustering framework, and if all nodes of a cluster are in same network then the underlying &JEE.PLATFORM; clustering will handle automatically the discovery of new cluster nodes and join these to the cluster. For not so simple setups refer to &JEE.PLATFORM; clustering documentation.

section.title: Managing Components in &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE Cluster

variablelist.para: &THIS.PLATFORM; JAIN SLEE clustering does not requires special components management, simply (un)deploy components in all cluster nodes, and even in fault tolerance setups the cluster will properly handle such operations. But there is special behavior to be aware, for fault tolerance setups:

listitem.para: JAIN SLEE Service Started Events are only fired on the first cluster node started
only the last node will force the service's sbb entities removal
only the last node will force the removal of all its activities
